response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "medium", "Being a 19‐year-old male is associated with higher risk due to less maturity and impulsivity often seen in young adults."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Identifying as Black may intersect with systemic biases that can affect outcomes, though it is not a direct causal factor."],
    ["Arrest History", "low", "A single arrest with no conviction suggests minimal prior criminal involvement."],
    ["Education", "high", "Not having a high school diploma or GED is strongly associated with increased recidivism risk due to reduced opportunities."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Having only 2 jobs in a year indicates employment instability, which can contribute to higher risk."],
    ["Drug Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use in the past four years represents a moderate risk factor, as substance use can be correlated with recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "The absence of recent depressive symptoms reduces immediate concerns regarding mental health risk factors."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in a small rural household with a single biological parent can impart mixed influences related to support and supervision."],
    ["Religious/Spiritual Beliefs", "medium", "Considering that God has nothing to do with personal outcomes might indicate weaker community or moral support structures."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being a 19‐year-old male is associated with higher risk due to less maturity and impulsivity often seen in young adults.
Identifying as Black may intersect with systemic biases that can affect outcomes, though it is not a direct causal factor.
A single arrest with no conviction suggests minimal prior criminal involvement.
Not having a high school diploma or GED is strongly associated with increased recidivism risk due to reduced opportunities.
Having only 2 jobs in a year indicates employment instability, which can contribute to higher risk.
Recent marijuana use in the past four years represents a moderate risk factor, as substance use can be correlated with recidivism.
The absence of recent depressive symptoms reduces immediate concerns regarding mental health risk factors.
Growing up in a small rural household with a single biological parent can impart mixed influences related to support and supervision.
Considering that God has nothing to do with personal outcomes might indicate weaker community or moral support structures.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in a rural area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
